image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson tells her triple-murder trial she first began foraging wild mushrooms during Victoria's COVID lockdowns, years before hosting her in-laws for a fatal meal.

title.children: Erin Patterson tells jury she accepts death cap mushrooms were in meal

image.altText: Presidential candidate Lee Jae-Myung holding up a baseball

props.synopsis: The election comes after six months of turmoil sparked by a shock martial law briefly imposed by former leader Yoon Suk Yeol.

title.children: Liberal Lee Jae-myung projected to win South Korea's snap presidential election

image.altText: Side profile of Geert Wilders wearing a suit with his hair combed back

props.synopsis: Geert Wilders says his coalition partners are not willing to embrace his ideas of halting asylum migration, for which he had demanded immediate support last week.

title.children: Dutch government collapses after far-right leader quits coalition

image.altText: An explosion coming from underwater with black smoke rising by  a bridge structure.

props.synopsis: Ukraine used 1,100 kilograms of explosives which were detonated early in the morning, damaging underwater pillars of the bridge.

title.children: Ukraine hits Crimea bridge with underwater explosives

image.altText: Signage at a Telstra store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The telco giant has paid a penalty and agreed to launch an independent review after it mistakenly disabled its connection to an emergency call relay service used by people with hearing or speech impairments.

title.children: Telstra fined for disruption to emergency call service

image.altText: Aboriginal man, gray hair, in a button up shirt sitting in front of a sign that reads 'Blak Lives Matter' on an Aboriginal flag

props.synopsis: The grandfather of a 24-year-old Aboriginal man who died in police custody in Alice Springs last week has renewed his demands for CCTV vision and an independent probe into the death.

title.children: Kumanjayi White's family says police refusal to release CCTV a 'disgrace'

image.altText: Putin looks very sad

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy sent delegates to Istanbul to talk peace, but a day prior Ukraine sent its strongest signal to Russia and any third-party brokers: The war is not lost, writes Emily Clark.

title.children: Putin likes the upper hand, but before Istanbul Zelenskyy played an ace

image.altText: Two men wearing black clothing walk through a dark door with concerned looks on tehir faces.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu runs a controversial yet lucrative citizenship-by-investment scheme that critics say has attracted organised criminals and oligarchs.

title.children: Vanuatu vows to restore 'confidence' in passports after Tate revelation

image.altText: White commonwealth war grave headstone which reads Q272379 Private Ngarkwokka Torres Strait Lt. Inf. Bn 20th April 1945 age 37.

props.synopsis: More than a century after his real name was written out of history, a chance encounter and a lucky find at a rubbish tip restore a soldier's true identity and return him to his family.

title.children: Pure luck identifies soldier buried with wrong name, solving 80-year-old mystery

image.altText: Israel Palestinians

props.synopsis: The Israeli military said its forces had opened fire on a group of people who had left designated routes near the US and Israeli backed food distribution site.

title.children: Third day Palestinians killed near Gaza aid site, health authorities say

image.altText: Zamzam camp

props.synopsis: The world's most "damaging displacement crisis" is now in its third year, with many survivors facing lack of shelter due to funding shortages, the organisation says.

title.children: More than four million refugees have fled Sudan, UN says

image.altText: A screenshot of a ticket website showing "Fans ahead of you in the queue: 197986"

props.synopsis: Fans complain across social media about the issues faced in buying tickets, with one saying it has been "one of the most frustrating experiences" he has been through.

title.children: Ashes tickets pre-sale sets new record but leaves some fans 'frustrated'

image.altText: William Seamons stands in front of shop window with arms folded

props.synopsis: Millions of Australian workers will get a 3.5 per cent pay rise from July 1, following the Fair Work Commission's annual review of the minimum wage and award agreements. Inflation is currently at 2.4 per cent annually.

title.children: 'A dollar for me, a dollar for my family': Minimum, award wages rise 3.5pc

image.altText: Guards stand behind police tape in front of a red brick archway.

props.synopsis: More than 200 inmates attacked guards and fled after they were allowed to leave their cells because of earthquake tremors.

title.children: Hundreds of prisoners escape after earthquake in Pakistan

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: A trial date and location have been confirmed for the man charged with the alleged murder of Ballarat mother Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Trial date set for Patrick Stephenson, accused of killing Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A man's fist reaches out as a woman holds up her hand to protect herself.

props.synopsis: The longitudinal study showed social support and strong father-son relationships were key in reducing the risk of men later committing emotional or physical abuse.

title.children: One in three Australian men report using intimate partner violence, study reveals

image.altText: a long slver fish washed up on a beach

props.synopsis: When Sybil Robertson took a stroll at Ocean Beach on Monday, she was unaware she was about to join the small and exclusive club of people who have found an oarfish.

title.children: Dog walker finds elusive 'doomsday' fish on remote Tasmanian beach

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff appears to be in thought, surrounded by his colleagues.

props.synopsis: A no-confidence motion has been tabled by Labor targeting Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff over the state budget debt and his handling of the Spirit of Tasmania replacement project. The Premier says a successful motion would force an election.

title.children: Tasmanian Premier warns no-confidence motion will force early election

image.altText: A man poses smiling next to some mangoes on a tree.

props.synopsis: A British tourist has had the charges against her relating to a fatal e-scooter crash upgraded, after the 51-year-old pedestrian she allegedly crashed into while intoxicated dies in a Perth hospital.

title.children: Allegedly drunk UK e-scooter rider has charges upgraded after fatal crash

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and a watch smiles at the camera in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: The 32-year-old was awaiting trial at Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre after being charged with the murder of her daughter, three-year-old Sophia Rose.

title.children: Coroner to investigate death of mother charged with murdering 3yo daughter

image.altText: Snake bite victim Tristian James Frahm wearing a Harry Potter costume

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has been told an 11-year-old Queensland boy would likely have survived a fatal snakebite if he had received medical treatment.

title.children: Family 'haunted' by questions after boy's snakebite death

image.altText: An adult cane toad sitting on the ground.

props.synopsis: Milk squeezed from the glands of cane toads could be key to controlling the invasive pests in Australia, with the toxic liquid being used to bait underwater traps.

title.children: Cane toad toxin could reshape how the invasive pests are managed

image.altText: Milos Degenek points at opponent with his left hand

props.synopsis: Miloš Degenek has played his club football in hostile environments in Serbia and believes Australia's ability to create a strong home ground advantage is hampered by Football Australia's rules and a heavy police presence at matches.

title.children: Socceroos veteran says police, flare bans restrict Australia's home advantage

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios looks down

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios's wait to return to the Wimbledon court after making the 2022 singles final extends into a third year after he confirmed a "small setback" in his injury recovery.

title.children: Injury 'setback' forces Kyrgios to miss third straight Wimbledon campaign

image.altText: Adolescence star Owen Cooper shared the Gotham Award for Outstanding Supporting Performance

props.synopsis: The UK limited series, which looks at the impact of the online manosphere, took home the biggest award of the night, as well as several others.

title.children: Owen Cooper wins first major award for chilling Adolescence performance

image.altText: A golden coloured dog in the arms of a firefighter.

props.synopsis: Ted the Labrador is rescued unharmed from an 8-metre-deep mine shaft in Central Victoria four days after escaping his backyard with labradoodle Penny.

title.children: Missing for four days, Labrador Ted turns up in a mine shaft

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers in front of a black background.

props.synopsis: The proposal to tax earnings for super balances over $3 million, including on unrealised gains, is the subject of renewed controversy following the federal election.

title.children: How does Labor's new super tax work and why is it controversial?

image.altText: Matthew Miller stands at a State Department podium.

props.synopsis: Matthew Miller, the former top US State Department spokesperson who sparred with journalists when they raised allegations of war crimes, now says Israel has "without a doubt" committed war crimes in Gaza.

title.children: Biden spokesman who defended Israel now says it committed war crimes

image.altText: A low resolution photo of a middle aged man with glasses wearing a black hat.

props.synopsis: A man, who's body was found in an industrial-sized bin at the rear of a business in Hobart, has been named by Tasmania Police.

title.children: Police release name of man found dead in bin in Hobart

image.altText: A crypto ATM is seen on a street with a man walking behind it.

props.synopsis: Australians are losing millions of dollars each year to scams involving cash deposits at cryptocurrency ATMs — machines authorities warn are increasingly being exploited by criminals for money laundering.

title.children: Older Australians losing millions in scams involving crypto ATMs

image.altText: A woman having a cosmetic injectible in her lip.

props.synopsis: The Australian health practitioner regulator introduces sweeping new guidelines for dentists and nurses performing non-surgical cosmetic injectable procedures, in a bid to better protect consumers.

title.children: 'Crystal clear' new rules for nurses, dentists performing cosmetic injectables

image.altText: Chives the cat sits on Kerry's lap

props.synopsis: While most people think of dogs and horses when it comes to animal-assisted therapy, there is a growing interest around cats like Chives, a Devon Rex working in a Brisbane therapy room.

title.children: The rise of therapy cats and how they compare to dogs

image.altText: Joanna Pascua

props.synopsis: Joanna Pascua wins the right to Australian workplace protections despite living almost 6,000 kilometres away. Lawyers say she paved the way for legal claims, including class actions, against employers by "exploited" offshore workers.

title.children: Filipino woman changes the game for Australia's 'exploited' offshore workers

image.altText: Madeleine McCann

props.synopsis: The disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann remains unsolved after 18 years. Now Portuguese and German police have launched fresh searches to find her.

title.children: What police hope a new search for Madeleine McCann uncovers

image.altText: Simon Smale with Alex Kelly at Wembley Stadium

props.synopsis: Travelling half way around the world to watch a football game is not for everyone. But as Simon Smale writes, some things are more important.

title.children: Madness or devotion? Why I came half way round the world for a football game
